poem:
**The Parting**  

The world, a book  
we choose not to read—  
pages turned by winds  
of discord. Across seas,  
an abandoned lighthouse,  
its beam refracted  
by walls of pride.  
Voices echo empty halls;  
maps curl at the edges.  
The ink of unity fades  
to ghostly whispers,  
lost in solitary  
shadows.
